physicalLayer

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • physicalLayer.Agent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SocialActionAgent

    public abstract class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class to model an Agent that is situated in an environment, that has a two-layered neural network architecture for learning and decision-making. Sub-goals are generated by the deliberative layer, and these sub-goals are actioned by the reactive layer which decides on the immediate next steps based on the chosen sub-goals.
    Version:
    v1.2
    Author:
    Chloe M. Barnes

      Whether a Stone is being carried (initially false).
      protected Cell cell
      The current location.
      protected int cols
      The number of columns in the environment.
      protected DecisionNetwork decisionNetwork
      The deliberative network used to generate sub-goals based on the current state.
      protected java.lang.Double fitness
      The current fitness based on performance.
      protected boolean hasCarried
      Whether a Stone has ever been carried (initially false).
      protected boolean hasDroppedinRiver
      Whether it has dropped a Stone in the river to build a bridge (initially false).

      The reactive network used to hill-climb towards sub-goals.

      The number of Resource objects that have been found.
      protected int rows
      The number of rows in the environment.

      The initial location.

      The assigned target Resources to collect in order to achieve the goal.

        protected static boolean partialBridgeExists
        A bridge is built if the number of Stones put onto a Water cell equals the depth of the river. A partial bridge exists when this is not equal but is more than 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Agent

        public Agent(Cell cell,
             int rows,
             int cols)
        For invocation by subclasses. Creates an agent with an initial location in its environment, empty decision-making layers (random genes) and no allocated targets.
        Parameters:
        cell - The initial location in the environment.
        rows - The number of rows in the environment.
        cols - The number of columns in the environment.

      • Agent

        public Agent(int rows,
             int cols)
        For invocation by subclasses. Creates an agent with no initial location in its environment, empty decision-making layers (random genes) and no allocated targets.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the environment.
        cols - The number of columns in the environment.

      • Agent

        public Agent(int rows,
             int cols,
             double[][][] genes)
        For invocation by subclasses. Creates an agent with no initial location, populated with given genes in the deliberative layer, an empty reactive layer and no allocated targets.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the environment.
        cols - The number of columns in the environment.
        genes - A 3D array containing the genes to populate the new agent with.

    • Method Detail

      • getTargets

        public java.util.ArrayList<Resource> getTargets()
        Returns the collection of allocated Resources which are the targets to collect in order to achieve the goal.
        Returns:
        The collection of target Resources that have been allocated.

      • setResource

        public void setResource(Resource target)
        Allocates a Resource as a target to collect in order to achieve the goal. All targets must be collected.
        Parameters:
        target - A Resource which must be collected in order to achieve the goal.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the current state, including starting location, moves, whether it is alive etc.

      • produceOffspring

        public abstract Agent produceOffspring(Agent other)
        Creates a new offspring based on this and another Agent, with no initial location.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Agent in which this Agent should produce an offspring with.
        Returns:
        A new offspring with this and another Agent as its parents.

      • produceTraditionalOffspring

        public abstract Agent produceTraditionalOffspring(java.util.ArrayList<double[][][]> genes)
        Creates a new offspring with no initial location, which is a representative state of the population at the current timestep.
        Parameters:
        genes - The genes of the population, which can be processed depending on the definition of "tradition".
        Returns:
        A new agent that is a representative state of the population at the current timestep.

      • evaluate

        public abstract java.lang.Double evaluate(int maxMoves)
        Calculates and returns the fitness of the Agent based on a specified metric.
        Parameters:
        maxMoves - The maximum number of moves that an Agent can take in an environment.
        Returns:
        The calculated fitness of the Agent.

      • move

        public abstract Cell[][] move(double[] status,
                              Cell[][] grid)
        Perform actions in a single move in a single timestep.
        Parameters:
        status - The status of the agent, like what type of cell it is on in the environment.
        grid - The state of the environment at the current timestep.
        Returns:
        The updated state of the environment.

        Parameters:

      • isCarrying

        public boolean isCarrying()
        Returns whether a CellObject is being carried or not (currently only a Stone).
        Returns:
        true if something is being carried, false otherwise.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Returns whether the agent is alive or not. It will be alive unless it moves to a dangerous location in the environment.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is alive, false otherwise.

      • setAlive

        public void setAlive(boolean a)
        Sets whether the agent is alive or not.
        Parameters:
        a - true if it is alive, false otherwise.

      • hasAchievedGoal

        public boolean hasAchievedGoal()
        Returns whether the goal has been achieved or not (if all the target Resources have been collected).
        Returns:
        true if all target Resources have been collected, false otherwise.

        public java.lang.Double getFitness()
        Returns the current fitness.
        Returns:
        The current fitness.

      • getMoves

        public int getMoves()
        Returns the number of moves that have been taken.
        Returns:
        The number of moves taken.

      • setPartialBridgeExists

        public void setPartialBridgeExists(boolean exists)
        Sets whether a bridge has been partially built in the world. A bridge is built successfully when the number of Stones placed into a Water cell equal its depth. A partial bridge is built if a number of Stones less than the depth but more than zero are placed in it.
        Parameters:
        exists - Whether a partial bridge exists.

      • getPartialBridgeExists

        public boolean getPartialBridgeExists()
        Returns if a bridge has been partially built in the world. A bridge is built successfully when the number of Stones placed into a Water cell equal its depth. A partial bridge is built if a number of Stones less than the depth but more than zero are placed in it.
        Returns:
        true if a partial bridge exists, false otherwise.

      • getActivationLandscape

        public java.lang.Double[][] getActivationLandscape()
        Returns a 2D array representing the activation landscape, which is used to hill-climb towards sub-goals.
        Returns:
        A 2D array representing the activation landscape.
